nodes.bodyText: Why are we suppressing warnings here (and below)?
This is just to get rid of Type safety: Unchecked cast warnings in eclipse editor. It is not important, I'll remove them.
I wouldn't think this was an xor from the name. Maybe isEitherSampleListIdXOrSampleIdsPresent?
It looks correct to me Either...Or. If we want to include xor then I think it should be sampleListIdXOrSampleIdsPresent

I would think a test to see if value or range is present would be
v.getValue() != null || (v.getStart() != null || v.getEnd() != null)
By checking that the two checks evaluate to the same boolean, you're marking a rows as invalid when it has both a range and a value, or neither a range nor a value. Is that what you want?
looks correct to me. If two checks evaluate to the same boolean then it is invalid, which we are evaluating.
Is addressing this TODO within the scope of this PR?

nodes.bodyText: I didn't see a DataBinHelperTest in the files - this seems like a good method to unit test.
true, but looks like this scenario is tested while testing DataBinner in DataBinnerTest.java

You added logic to dataBinHelper for when start and end are null. Here, you check that in this ternary, so you never pass null, null. Could you eliminate this check and change the behavior of calcRange, or are you doing calcRange(null, null) elsewhere?
I was just moving calcRange from one class to another(for some spring dependency injection issues), wasn't checking what it was doing. Yeah, looks like this logic can be removed.
Looks like calcRange is used even in other files which requires to check those fields for null
What am I missing here? You add the dataBinHelper, but never use it.
dataBinHelper is used in this class. I just changed to constructor injection to property injection
